frontmatter.description: Reading user input is an important part of a program. To collect user input from the terminal in Python, we use the input() method. To store user input to a variable, use 'variable = input()'
frontmatter.title: Python For Loops

frontmatter.description: Reading user input is an important part of a program. To collect user input from the terminal in Python, we use the input() method. To store user input to a variable, use 'variable = input()'
frontmatter.title: Python Input

frontmatter.description: An if statement in python uses the keyword if, then the block of code that the if statement runs is denoted by indentation. An if statement is useful when you want to redirect the flow of your program and act accordingly to user input
frontmatter.title: Python If Statements

frontmatter.description: Variables in Python does not need to be declared with a data type unlike statically typed languages. This nature of not needing a declared data type is called dynamic typing. You can declare a variable in Python just by assigning a value to it with varName = value
frontmatter.title: Python Variables
